Hello avinashnash,

I'm not entirely clear on what you're asking. What is the output of your 
Html Parser? Or equivalently, what input does your "requirement" expect?

Noah

avinashnash wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Can any one help me in this case.I will describe u the scenario which
> is happening now in my case and what i need
>
> Existing scenario:
> 1. Create seed file
> 2. Create job order
> 3. Start crawler
> 4. Crawl the URL
> 5. The contents will be extracted and stored in the Arc directry in
> Jobs folder
> 6. The arc.gz file will contains the whole contents in it
> 7. Read the arc.gz file 
> 8. Parse the contents using Html Parser
> 9. Get the Html contents and use it for our requirement
>
> What I need:
> 1. Create seed file
> 2. Create job order
> 3. Start crawler
> 4. Crawl the URL
> 5. The contents will be extracted and stored in the Arc directry in
> Jobs folder
> 6. The arc.gz file which is created must contain the parsed Html
> contents so that I can directly use it for our requirement with out
> going through 7, 8, 9 steps in the present scenario that i have
> specified above.
>
> Is there any option or extractors in heritrix which help this to
> happen. If any one can help me with your valuable suggestion that
> would be a great help for me.
>
> Regards
>
>
